answers.answer: No, but I know someone with both

There's a school of thought that if you don't treat either Celiac or non celiac gluten sensitivity then you run the risk of full blown autoimmunity that can manifest itself in any one of a number of autoimmune diseases, including MS, lupus and diabetes etc.Here's the link to the article:http://www.hindawi.com/journals/crii/2013/248482/CheersPoppy

Dr. Perlmutter's work has been the subject of negative crtiticism. In the "stud" linked above there were only 3 participants. I'm not sure how any credibility can be attached.Just one man's opinion :-)Kyle
I don't understand what that means, red star. Can you explain?
HLA-DQB1*0201 is listed under both Celiac and MS so that is the link I can find between the two conditions.
I have MS but not Celiac disease.Julie

question: Anyone else on her have both MS and Celiac Disease? I'm convinced there is a connection.-Lauren
title: MS and Celiac
